newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume dives on higher prices.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume dives on higher prices.

text.p: Traded volume on Istanbul's gold exchange tumbled to 355 kilos on Friday from Thursday's 930 kilos as free market demand shrank on firmer gold prices ahead of the weekend, dealers said.
Gold leapt to $359.30 an ounce at close from Thursday's $356.00 in line with the firmer levels in European markets.
In lira terms, it jumped to 1,284,100 lira per gram from previous 1,266,800, also due to the weakness of the lira which ended at 110,650 against the dollar, versus 110,475.
There was 155 kilos of trade in the morning session and 200 kilos in the afternoon, 52 percent of the turnover was made lira terms.
Volume had hit a record 2,570 kilos on Wednesday on heavy trade among banks to benefit from lower gold prices and upward lira/dollar rates.
